intro: Albugoides erectum, commonly known as the upright blightweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Albugoides erectum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
